attributes.action: address the rise in positive tests for illicit drugs within the armed forces
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
AOL today reports a rise in positive tests for illegal substances in the Army which causes the loss of almost a "battalion a year" due to illegal drug use, the research said. 

The findings also showed a four-fold growth in soldiers testing positive for the class A drug cocaine.

Research into compulsory drugs testing (CDT) of UK service personnel identified a rise in positive tests for illegal substances in the British Army from 517 individual cases in 2003, to 795 in 2005 and 769 in 2006.
The petitioner is calling on the PM to address this as a recruitment and retention policy - and improve the reasons why servicemen feel the need to resort to drugs.
